overview:
Vast Ventures is a group of private equity funds that invest in, and incubate, innovative companies.

Vast Ventures is managed by Doug Chertok, who has founded, advised and invested in early-stage companies for over 20 years, including Bidclix (sold to Aquantive, now Microsoft), Fotolog (sold to Hi-Media), Quigo (sold to Time Warner), Apparel Media, The Backplane, BoostCTR, Clipboard, Conductor, Daylife, Fashism, FirstFuel, Hashable, Kiip, Klout, MeetUp, Moat, OpenX, SimplyMeasured, StreetEasy, StyleSeat and ZocDoc. He is also the founder of StreetEasy, the largest NYC residential real-estate listings site.
